respStmt.name: Varios hablantes del Mixteco de Mixtepec
multiple unnamed Mixtepec-Mixtec speakers

publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

notesStmt.note: Éste es el cuento de un hombre que compró cuatro burros. Luego pensó que tenía tres burros. Entonces, ¿por qué el título del cuento dice que son cinco burros? Este cuento nos enseña que debemos contar con mucho cuidado.

sourceDesc.bibl:
Ntiu'un lurru Beckmann, Gisela; Nieves, María M.. 2008. (2nd ed.).Tlalpan, D.F., México:Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C.
linguistic consultation multiple unnamed Mixtepec-Mixtec speakers
Obtained from:

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;
textDesc.derivation: this document is labeled "original" because the XML-TEI markup of it's contents have not made any alterations to the original content;

normalization.ab: 2018-04-05Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml. Instances of "ña" still remain to be changed pending consultation with Mille (or other person working on orthography).

spanGrp.span: One day a man went to the plaza.
Un día un hombre fue a la plaza.
Then he then returned home very happy.
Y volvió a casa muy feliz.
Then he rode one donkey and he followed the three donkeys.
Y él montó un burro y siguió los tres burros.
When he was half way along the path, he began to count the donkeys.
Cuando llegó a mitad camino, empezó a contar los burros.
And he saw that there were only three of them.
Y vió que habían solamente tres de ellos.
Then he realized that one of his donkeys was missing, he then started to cry.
Y se dío cuenta de que falta un de sus burros, y empezó a llorar.
When he got home he said to his wife:
Cuando llegó a casa, él dijó a su esposa:
I bought four donkeys and now there are only three of them because they stole one.
Yo compré cuatro burros y ahora hay solamente tres porqué me robaron uno de ellos.
And he laughed because he saw that there were four donkeys, then he said:
Y se rió porque vió que habían cuatro burros y dijó:
repetitive" e.g. 'he was a good man he was'
I see five donkeys, you are riding one of them, you are corraling three of them and you are the fifth one.
Yo veo cinco burros porque uno de ellos es (?), y tres de ellos siguen, y tú haces cinco.
The people are correct to say:
Those who are foolish, without brains like animals, suffer.
conjugates the same as take a shit.
How many sacks is the donkey carrying?
How many sacks are sitting on the ground?
¿Cuantos sacos son situados por la tierra?
There are ______ sacks on the ground.
How much does two plus six make?
Three donkeys plus five donkeys, how many does that make?
Tres burros y cinco burros, ¿cuanto igual?
One donkey plus five donkeys, how much does that make?
Un burro y cinco burros, ¿cuanto igual?
